intro: Pachytrophe obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate pachytrophe, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its lanceolate to obovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short peduncles. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
